item.title: Report E-2025020105
item.description:
Report E-2025020105

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T03:17:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-10
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 10, 2025, two (2) 55-gallon drums of UN2922 had loose lids and leaked approximately two (2) ounces of product to the outside of the drums. R+L retained Cura Emergency Services who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE). TLE personnel overpacked the damaged drums into two (2) 85-gallon overpacks.

item.title: Report E-2025020130
item.description:
Report E-2025020130

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-07
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 7, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was damaged and released approximately one (1) gallon to the trailer and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the site. The crew overpacked the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum. TLE used absorbents and hand tools to collect all material in the same one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2025020367
item.description:
Report X-2025020367

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-06
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Cassie Osterfeld, 064 Operations Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a potential Hazardous spill. Cassie Osterfeld advised the spill is actively leaking from the trailer striking the yard. Cassie Osterfeld advised after looking at the manifest 064 believes it's leaking from a 55 gallon drum with a white appearance. Per CURA cause of damage is an appeared forklift strike prior to arriving at the 064 SC.

item.title: Report I-2025010024
item.description:
Report I-2025010024

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-26
  • City: MASSILLON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PVS driver was offloading Ferric with no view of the tank. Site representative was watching tank levels. As driver was nearing end of the load, site representative asked him to shut off tank, however tank was already over filling. Site representative indicated they had a rope and ball gauge and it was sticking and not functioning properly. No injuries/exposure.
